Welcome to Fourth assignment cmepda’s documentation!¶

This package is based on the Python scientific ecosystem allowing to generate pseudo-random numbers with abitrary probability density functions. At his core there’s a powerful ProbabilityDensityFunction class.

Guide¶

class main.ProbabilityDensityFunction(x, y)¶

Class describing pdfs.

Parameters

  • x (array-like) – The array of x values to be passed to the pdf.

  • y (array-like) – The array of y values to be passed to the pdf.

probability(x1, x2)¶

Returns the probability for a random variabile to be included between x1 and x2.

Parameters

  • x1 (float) – One bound for the integration.

  • x2 (float) – The other bound for the integration.

Returns

The probability bewteen x1 and x2.

Return type

float

rnd(size=1000)¶

Returns an array of random values from the pdf.

Parameters

size (int, optional) – The number of values to be extracted, defaults to 1000.

Returns

The array of values distributed according to the pdf.

Return type

array
